request.description:
This is used to create a stripe plan
This needs to be run before we register any user since we are assuming that a stripe plan would already be present

- This is used to register a user to a basic-monthly plan.
basic-monthly is the plan id of the plan created in the previous request(Create Plan request)
- This subscribes user to a plan whose id is passed in the path

- Login api which uses Basic Authentication
- Returns the user object

header.name: Cache-Control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: Pragma
header.description: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

header.name: Transfer-Encoding
header.description: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity.

header.name: WWW-Authenticate
header.description: Indicates the authentication scheme that should be used to access the requested entity.

header.name: X-Content-Type-Options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: X-Frame-Options
header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

header.name: X-XSS-Protection
header.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter

request.description:
- Webhook for payment failure and payment success
- We can change the customer value in the data object to a customer id from the db and check the termination of accounts and the trigger of emails
- Utility api to get detail about oneself

request.description:
- Update api
- Apart from some fields(email, firstName, lastName, password) rest of the fields are not affected since they are generated by system/Stripe
- Reset password and Update payment are separate apis

request.description:
- Update card details of customer
- token in POST body is the Stripe token of the new card
- This is used to generate service for download, it's just a dummy api now.
